The collar is a captivating blend of punk-inspired style and elegance, making it a unique accessory for women and girls seeking to make a statement.  From the moment I put it on, I was drawn to the softness of the PU leather, which offers a comfortable fit while exuding an edgy charm. The adjustable design ensures a customizable fit, allowing the collar to sit just right on your neckline.  What I appreciate most is the fusion of punk aesthetics and versatile fashion, making this choker suitable for a range of outfits, from casual to bold ensembles. As someone who enjoys expressing individuality through accessories, the collar has become a favorite for adding a touch of rebellion to my look.  One thing to note is that this collar may require a little breaking in for optimal comfort, but the unique style is well worth it. This collar is a standout piece that adds a hint of punk flair to your wardrobe. Whether you're embracing your inner rockstar or simply want to elevate your outfit, this choker collar offers a touch of distinctiveness to your style. Embrace the punk-inspired elegance of the collar - it's a bold accessory that lets you express yourself with confidence!

Definitely worth the money; I'll be getting more chokers from Ethoon. c:

These chokers are totally adorable! I love cats and enjoy buying cat themed stuff like this. It fits me the best when put on the last button, as my neck circumference is pretty small. If I put it on the middle button, it’s too loose and moves around. If you have a slightly bigger neck, or a more muscular neck, then you may find this will fit you just fine. For the slim necked ladies out there, it may be ok on the last button, but it might be too big on children, young teens, petite women, etc.

It's very cute at first but also very cheap. If you want a choker don't get the ones with snappy buttons. I would take a picture but unfortunately I threw mine away which I will say why in a bit. I bought the choker simply for show and nothing more, if you feel like you want a choker for OTHER reasons I recommend one that has an actual buckle. But anyways- I get buckled chokers as well however they're spendy. This choker is cute and my boyfriend liked it as well. But unless you plan to wear this in water or keep it for a very long time I say you shouldn't. Get a different color instead just in case it gets especially wet. A solid color is best. I strongly recommend not to get the holographic filmed version of this choker because after accidentally getting it wet the film started to peel off. And I tried peeling the rest off to have a plain white one but it didn't work out too well. Anyways, I'm sure if you wear the choker a lot the same thing will happen anyways. Even though snap on chokers like these are cheap, holographic film covered ones are probably way cheaper. Giving it 4 stars because it was still cute though :) so If you want to get the holographic version, don’t wear it too much and don’t get it wet.
